purpose it is the purpose of this chapter to provide a just equitable and practicable method to be cumulative with and in addition to any other remedy provided by city ordinances or otherwise available at law whereby a public nuisance located on any premises or public property which from any cause endangers the life limb health morals property safety or welfare of the general public or which tends to lower the value of adjacent real property because of its unsightliness may be required to be repaired removed or abated part 1988   definitions for the purpose of this chapter certain container    right of entry whenever necessary to make an inspection to enforce any of the provisions of this chapter or whenever the building official or her or his authorized representative has reasonable cause to believe that there exists upon any premises any condition which is prohibited under this chapter the building official or her or his authorized representative may enter such building or premises at all reasonable times to inspect the same or to perform any duty imposed upon the building official by this chapter  provided that if such premises be occupied she or he shall first present proper credentials and request entry  and if such building or premises be unoccupied he or she shall first make a reasonable effort to locate the owner or other persons having charge or control of the premises and request entry if such entry is refused the building official or his or her authorized representative shall have recourse to every remedy provided by law to secure entry all of them shall be responsible for its removal part 1993   notice procedure the police department shall give notice of removal to the owner or occupant of the private property where it is located it shall constitute sufficient notice when a copy of same is sent by certified mail or personally delivered to the owner or occupant of the private property at his last known address part 1993   content of notice the notice shall contain the request for removal within fourteen days after the mailing of such notice and the notice shall advise that failure to comply with the notice to remove shall be a violation of this chapter part 1993   alternative abatement procedure recovery of expenses and storage the public nuisance defined in be abated and costs charged and or assessed as prescribed in of the municipal code part 1993   destruction or sale of motor vehicle declared a public nuisance any motor vehicle taken by the city for reasons of abating a public nuisance may be destroyed or sold pursuant to law as city surplus property as determined by the city commission if the owner thereof does not fully pay the city for its aggregate expenses incurred for the removal towing and storage of said motor vehicle before the expiration of thirty days from its taking    penalty for violation any person violating any of the provisions of this chapter shall be guilty of a municipal ordinance violation punishable by a fine not to exceed two hundred dollars or by imprisonment not to exceed thirty days or by both such fine and imprisonment and each and every day that the violation continues shall constitute a separate offense part 1993 nuisance vegetation   certain weeds and plants declared nuisances the following named weeds and plants shall be deemed dangerous and unhealthy and are declared to be nuisances ragweed pusley pigweed nettle thistle of any kind sunflower goldenrod tumbleweed burdock cocklebur sandbur wild oats sticktight milkweed mustard and any and all other variety of weeds and vegetation deemed to be noxious obnoxious dangerous and unhealthy or deemed to be a nuisance by the building official and all other weeds and grasses growing upon any lot or parcel of land in the city to a greater height than eight inches or which have gone or are about to go to seed  part 1996   duty to correct it shall be the duty of the occupant person in charge or owner of any lot or parcel of land in the city to keep such lot to include any abutting city rightofway commonly known as the city boulevard free of such nuisance vegetation by cutting spraying or removal as may be appropriate part 1996   public notice to correct a the building official or his authorized representative during the month of may shall by general public notice require all nuisance vegetation to be cut removed or sprayed as required by this chapter b such public notice shall be given generally by publication in the official newspaper once a week for two consecutive weeks c the notice shall provide that during the growing season every occupant person in charge or owner of any lot who fails to cut remove or spray nuisance vegetation is in violation of this chapter and shall further provide that in case of failure to cut or destroy such vegetation the city will cause the same to be cut and assess the costs thereof including the costs of levying such special assessment against the property benefitted part 1996   personal notice to correct a any occupant person in charge or owner of any lot in violation of this chapter shall receive written notice from the building official or his authorized representative of such violation b the occupant person in charge or owner shall within fortyeight hours after service of such notice cut remove or spray as required all nuisance vegetation c the notice shall provide that the occupant person in charge or owner of any lot shall cut remove or spray the nuisance vegetation within fortyeight hours after service of such notice and shall further provide that in case of failure to cut or destroy such nuisance vegetation the city will cause the same to be cut and assess the costs thereof including the costs of levying such special assessment against the property benefitted d service of such notice may be accomplished by personally delivering the notice upon either the occupant person in charge or owner of any lot personal service upon any one occupant person in charge or owner of any lot shall constitute service upon all service of such notice may also be accomplished by securely posting the notice in a conspicuous place on the affected premises part 1996   abatement by city a in the event the occupant person in charge or owner of any lot or parcel of land fails to correct any such vegetation nuisance as required the building official or his respective representative shall cause such nuisance vegetation to be cut sprayed or destroyed and for such purpose may enter upon any such lot or parcel of land b the city may contract with private persons or concerns to accomplish the removal of the nuisance vegetation as required by this chapter c it is a public offense for any person to intentionally interfere or attempt to interfere with the cutting spraying or removal of such nuisance vegetation by physical force violence threat of violence or physical intimidation d the building official or his respective representative may prepare a statement of costs incurred against each lot or parcel of land for the abatement of such nuisance vegetation and shall file such statement with the city finance officer on or before november 1st of each year cost incurred shall be defined as the actual expenses incurred for abatement of the vegetation nuisance plus a graduated noncompliance fee calculated over the calendar year as follows first violation abated fifty dollarnoncompliance fee  second violation abated one hundreddollar noncompliance fee  third violation abated one hundred fiftydollar noncompliance fee  fourth violation abated two hundreddollar noncompliance fee e any subsequent violations abated by the city within the current calendar year to be defined for the purposes of this chapter as the twelvemonth period starting january 1st and ending december 31st shall be billed at the two hundreddollar noncompliance fee rate the graduated noncompliance fee rate schedule shall apply to any and all violations abated by the city of huron as allowed in chapters 958 962 964 1116 and 1524 of this code  and all shall be cumulative in calculation of the noncompliance fee this graduated fee schedule shall become effective on   shall apply to an individual address lot or parcel of real property  and shall be calculated by calendar year except in the case of transfer of ownership however the cumulative calculation of the noncompliance fee shall continue in the case of transfers of ownership between immediate family members immediate family is defined for the purposes of this chapter as spouse child parent sibling grandparent grandchild inlaw wardguardian or cohabiting adult f right to appeal from building officials determination shall be available as specified in this code part 2004   part 1996   notice to property owner of costs within thirty days after the filing of the statement referred to in d the city finance officer shall cause a statement of the costs of the abatement to be served upon the owner agent of the owner lessee occupant or person in possession of the parcel of land on which the nuisance vegetation was abated such notice may be given personally or by the first class mail addressed to the last known address of the owner as shown on the director of equalizations records notice shall be further given that if the costs are not paid upon receipt of the statement the city may levy the costs as a special assessment against the property part 1996   recovery of costsspecial assessment the city may recover the costs incurred by the building official in abating nuisance vegetation by taxing the cost thereof by special assessment against the real property on which the nuisance occurred as authorized by state law part 1996   preparation of assessment rollpublic hearing a annually the finance officer shall prepare an assessment roll containing all costs of abating nuisance vegetation that the city elects to recover special assessment process upon completion of the assessment roll the finance officer shall file the assessment roll with the governing board after approval by the governing board they shall set a public hearing date on the assessment roll the public hearing date shall be no sooner than twenty days from the date of the meeting at which the public hearing date was set b thereupon the finance officer shall cause a notice of the time and place of hearing to be published in the official newspaper for two successive weeks prior to the date set for the hearing which notice shall in general terms describe the purpose for which the special assessment is levied the day of the filing of the assessment roll the time and place of the hearing thereon and that the assessment roll will be open for public inspection at the office of the finance officer c in addition to the publication of such notice of public hearing the finance officer shall mail a copy of the notice by first class certified mail addressed to the owner or owners of any property to be assessed for abatement costs at his or her address as shown by the records of the director of equalization and that such mailing shall be at least one week prior to the date set for the hearing d at the time and place fixed for such hearing the governing board shall meet to consider the assessment roll and hear any objections thereto upon such hearing it may approve amend or reject the same part 1996   penalty for violation any person firm or corporation violating any of the provisions of this chapter shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and shall be guilty of a separate offense for each and every day that the violation continues and shall be subject to a penalty pursuant to the general penalty provisions in except for purposes of this chapter any such fine imposed thereunder shall not be less than one hundred dollars  part 1996 nonnuisance motor vehicles on residential property   definitions for the purposes of this chapter the following terms shall have the following definitions a driveway means the area on a residential property designed or used for moving or parking of vehicles b residential property means 1 any parcel zoned residential  2 any parcel primarily used as residential  3 any vacant parcel located directly adjacent to a residential parcel as defined in subsections 1 and 2 above c reserved d vehicle means any device which is designed to travel along or on the ground or water and shall include but not be limited to automobiles buses motorbikes vans motorhomes pickup trucks motorcycles motor scooters trucks tractors gocarts golf carts campers trailers boats and farm equipment e vehicle unit means as determined by the inspections department representative 1 a single vehicle examples but are not limited to a car pickup truck van trailer etc 2 combinations of units parked in such a manner as to take no more space and create no more of a visual impact than a single vehicle examples but not limited to a loaded trailer or four motorcycles or three quads etc f yard means a required open space on a lot which is unoccupied and unobstructed by a building from its lowest ground level to the sky except as expressly permitted in this title a yard shall extend along a lot line and at right angles to such lot line to a depth or width specified in the yard regulations for the district in which such lot is located a yard shall be measured from the lot line to the vertical wall of the principal structure of structures 1 yard  front front yard means a yard extending along the full width of the front lot line between side lot lines and extending from abutting front street rightofway line to a depth at its shallowest required in the yard regulations for the district in which such lot is located 2 yard  rear rear yard means a yard extending along the full width of the rear lot line between the side lot lines and extending toward the front lot line for a depth as specified in the yard regulations for the district in which such lot is located 3 yard  side side yard means a yard extending along the side lot line between the front and rear yards having a width as specified in the yard regulations for the district in which such lot is located part 2008   vehicle parking on private residential property a maximum number of eight vehicle units may be parked on any residential property parcel except as otherwise permitted in this chapter or required by code part 2008   vehicle parking limitsexceptions certain vehicles shall not be included in determining the maximum number of vehicle units parked on residential property parcels a vehicles stored inside of a fully enclosed structure such as a garage or shed the enclosing structure must comply with all applicable building and zoning regulations b excess vehicle units as specified on an approved special parking permit c vehicle units parked on property within six blocks of the state fairground during south dakota state fair d excess vehicles temporarily present on property as a result of a limited duration special occasion in example but not limited to family reunions weddings funerals holiday gatherings anniversary celebrations birthday celebrations etc part 2008   vehicle parking on private residential propertylocation permitted parking of vehicles on private residential property shall be as follows a driveway parking on an established driveway on private property shall be permitted as long as no part to the vehicle extends over or otherwise interferes with the public use of the sidewalk b rear yard to the maximum extent possible all other vehicle parking shall be confined to the rear yard as defined in this chapter c side yard when there is no access to the rear yard or there is inadequate area available in the rear yard an applicants fence shall never be considered as denying access exposed vehicle parking may be located on side yards d front yard where access or area limitations preclude rear yard or side yard parking a maximum of thirty percent of the front yard including driveway may be used for parking or a total of three vehicle units may be parked in the front yard whichever is greater part 2008   prohibited parking no vehicles shall be parked or stored in such a manner or location as to a present a potential fire hazard as determined by the huron fire department chief administrator or his authorized representative b hinder police fire emergency services municipal service providers etc in the performance of their authorized duties c violate any law or ordinance including allowing a nuisance to exist on the property part 2008   special parking permit an owner or tenant of residential property may apply for a special parking permit authorizing the owner or tenant to park vehicles totaling more than eight vehicle units on their specific residential property parcel special parking permits shall remain in effect until revoked a all applications for special parking permit shall be filed in the building inspections office on forms provided by the city b public notice shall be given of the request a sign indicating that an application for a special parking permit has been filed shall be posted at the address listed on the application at least ten days prior decision date c requests for up to two excess units require payment of a twentydollarfee at the time of filing 1 request may be approved or denied by the building inspector or his or her designated official upon completion of an application and a tenday public comment period 2 the building inspector or his or her designated official may place conditions on the approval of any application 3 any person adversely affected by the decision of the building inspector shall have the right of appeal to the city commission such appeal shall be in writing shall state the objections of the person filing the same shall be filed with the municipal finance officer within the ten days after the date of the building inspectors decision the city commission shall determine whether the building inspectors decision shall be upheld modified or reversed d requests for three or more excess units require payment of a fiftydollarfee at the time of filing 1 notices shall be sent by regular mail to owners of property within one hundred fifty feet of the address listed on the application  2 request must be approved or denied by the city commission following the tenday public comment period  public comment may also be presented at the city commission meeting  3 the building inspections office may recommend conditions on the approval or recommend denial of any application along with its submission to the city commission  4 the city commission may place conditions on the approval of any application and shall decide regarding approval or denial part 2008   revocation of special parking permitcause any special parking permit may be revoked for cause permits may at any time be revoked by the building inspections officer based on complaints of neighboring property owners a report of noncompliance by the code enforcement officer or police department upon receipt of a public complaint the code enforcement officer shall investigate and determine the validity of the complaint and if there exists grounds for revocation and if such grounds exist he or she shall provide that information to the building inspections officer who may revoke the permit grounds for revocation include the following a violation of any condition of approval  b violation of any law or ordinance in connection with the parking permit  c creation of any nuisance to the neighborhood  d the residential property is transferred to a new owner  e receipt of a valid complaint city inspections department part 2008   effective date and enforcement a the effective date of this chapter shall be  b upon receipt of a complaint from an affected neighboring property occupantowner within one hundred fifty feet excluding alley and street rightofways the enforcement process shall proceed 1 the property in question shall be inspected to determine the validity of the complaint  2 if the complaint is valid notice shall be given to the occupant if occupied or owner if vacant in the form of an order to correct or a citation  3 a minimum fourteenday grace period shall be allowed for correction  4 after the specified grace period formal action may be taken and the owner andor tenant is subject to the penalties as set forth in part 2008 title 10  golf courses golf department courses and golf course the president and in his absence or disability the vicepresident shall have authority to sign execute and acknowledge in the name of the park and recreation board all contracts or documents as authorized by the park and recreation board and to carry out the normal business and functions of the city park and recreation department and to sign requisitions upon the city finance officer for warrants and for funds under control of and to be expended by the park and recreation board all such requisitions shall be countersigned by the secretary and in his absence or disability by some 2007   powers limitations and immunities except as may be limited within this chapter the city park and recreation board shall have all of those powers and be subject to the limitations and enjoy park and recreation board can act such prior approval shall be first obtained otherwise the board shall be charged with the supervision and management of all city park and recreation facilities and functions part 2007   board regulations any recommendation by the city park and recreation board to the governing body related to a proposed ordinance or amendment to an existing ordinance shall be by at length the resolution of the park and recreation board recommending the same but it is sufficient to recite the fact of such recommendation by such recreation board which recital shall be subject to a penalty pursuant to the general penalty provision in except for purposes of this chapter any such fine imposed thereunder shall not be less than one hundred dollars  dutch elm disease   declaration of policy notwithstanding any other provision of title 11 the city commission has determined that the health of the elm trees within the municipal limits is threatened by a fatal disease known as dutch elm disease it has further determined that the loss of elm trees growing upon public and private property would substantially depreciate the value of property within the city and impair the safety good order general welfare and convenience of the public it is the intention of the city commission to control and prevent the spread of this disease and this chapter is enacted for that purpose part 1976   public nuisances defined the city commission declares the following to be public nuisances 1 any living or standing elm tree or part thereof infected with the dutch elm disease fungus ceratocystis ulmi or which harbors the european elm bark beetle scolytus jultistriatus eichb andor the american elm bark beetle hylurgopinus rufipes marsh  2 any dead elm tree or part thereof including logs branches stumps firewood or other elm material from which the bark has not been removed and burned or sprayed with an effective insecticide for destroying elm bark beetles part 1976   nuisances prohibited no person shall permit any public nuisance as defined in this chapter to remain on the premises owned or controlled by him within the city part 1976   abatement of nuisances if the city parks and recreation director in person or by some qualified person acting for him determines upon inspection or examination that any public nuisance as defined in in or upon any public street alley park or other public place including the terrace strip between a curb and a lot line within the city he may cause it to be removed and burned or otherwise abate the same part 1980 part 1976   notice to abate if the city parks and recreation director in person or by some qualified person acting for him upon inspection or examination determines with reasonable certainty that any public nuisance as defined in in or upon private premises within the city he may immediately serve or cause to be served either personally or by us registered mail upon the owner of such property if he can be found or upon the occupant thereof a written notice to abate such nuisance within twenty days of service of the notice part 1980 part 1976   determination of disease if the city parks and recreation director is unable to determine with reasonable certainty whether or not a tree in or upon private premises is infected with dutch elm disease he is authorized to remove or cut specimens from such tree may forward such specimens for diagnosis and report to the plant pathology department of south dakota state university and may proceed as provided in this chapter upon receipt of a positive report from the department part 1980 part 1976   abatement by city if the owner or occupant of the property upon which any nuisance exists in violation of this chapter fails to abate such nuisance within the time specified in the notice to do so the city park and recreation director may cause the nuisance to be removed and burned or otherwise abated part 1980 part 1976   effect of abatement all abatements made under the provisions of this chapter shall be made in such manner as to destroy or prevent as fully as possible the spread of dutch elm disease or the insect pests or vectors known to carry such disease fungus part 1976   assessment of abatement cost the cost of abating any public nuisance as defined in this chapter shall be borne as follows 1 the entire cost of any abatement of a public nuisance as defined in this chapter on trees on any public street alley park or other public place including the terrace strip between a curb and a lot line shall be borne by the city 2 the cost of any abatement of a public nuisance as defined in this chapter on any private property shall be borne by the owner or owners of such property and shall be assessed against such property as provided in this chapter if any part of a tree constituting a nuisance hereunder is located on a property line the owners of property on either side of such line shall share equally in the general and commercial aviation in and for the city all rules regulations and policies of the airport board shall be subject to the approval of the city commission part 2005   appointment of board membersterms of office there shall not be less than five members on the airport board the mayor with the approval of the governing body shall appoint the members to the airport board each appointment shall be for five years such appointees are to hold office until their successors are appointed and qualified such successors need not be residents or freeholders of the city part 2007 part 2005   annual appointments at the first regular meeting of the city commission in may of each year and subject to the approval of the governing board the mayor shall appoint to a term of five years such board members as may be necessary to have a full complement of board members appointments shall commence on june 1st and expire on may 31st the members comprising the airport board shall not hold any other elective or appointive office in the municipal government part 2007 part 2005   board compensation all members appointed to service on the airport board shall serve without compensation except for expenses accrued due to authorized travel outside the city in fulfilling the obligations of their appointed duties such expenses shall be reimbursed on the basis of actual proof of personal expenses accrued due to and during such travel authorized by the airport board at a regular board meeting part 2005   performance bond and oath each member of the board before entering upon his official duties shall give bond to the city in the amount of five hundred dollars for the faithful performance of his duties and shall take and file with the finance officer the bond and the usual oath of office required from appointive officers of the city the city shall pay any premium for the bonds required to be given by members of the board all official bonds required under the provisions of this chapter shall be approved by the governing body part 2005   board vacancies any vacancy on the airport board shall be filled for the unexpired term of any member vacating the board for any reason or purpose in the same manner as is required for a regular appointment and shall also qualify as provided in this chapter part 2005   election of officers at the first regular meeting of the airport board the board shall elect from its number a president vice president and a secretary each of whom shall serve until the first meeting of june the following year the vice president shall act in the absence or disability of the president in case of death or retirement of an officer a successor shall be elected from the remaining board members at the next official meeting subsequent thereto part 2005   official meetingsquorum the board shall hold regular meetings at least once each month and as many special meetings as it deems proper and necessary to conduct the official business affairs of the municipal airport department meetings of the airport board are subject to sdcl 125 three members shall constitute a quorum for the purpose of transacting any official business or authorizing the expenditures of any municipal airport funds however an affirmative vote of three or more board members shall be required for all official action of the airport board part 2005   official records and reports the secretary of the board shall keep a record of its proceedings and make such reports as may be required by the board in his absence or inability to act the board may appoint a secretary pro tem to perform his duties the records of the board kept by its secretary or copies of any such records when duly certified by the secretary shall be competent evidence of the proceedings of the board copies of any or all such records andor reports shall be filed with the finance officer for city record purposes part 2005   board rules and regulations the airport board subject to the approval of the governing body may establish bylaws rules and regulations for the orderly transaction of business and operation of the municipal airport department and its facilities any amendment to this chapter as desired by the board shall be requested by resolution as outlined in this chapter part 2005   board authority and duties the president and in his absence or disability the vicepresident shall have the authority to sign execute and acknowledge in the name of the airport board all contracts or documents as authorized by the airport board and to carry out the normal business and functions of the municipal airport department and to sign requisitions upon the city finance for warrants and for funds to be expended by the airport board all such warrants shall be drawn by the city finance office and be signed by the mayor and city finance officer any warrants drawn shall be recorded in the official financial ledgers of the city and drawn on the municipal airport department cash funds part 2005   powers limitations and immunities the airport board shall have all of those powers and be subject to the limitations and enjoy those privileges and immunities as all provided for by this chapter and by chapters 506 507 and 508 of the south dakota codified laws as now or hereafter amended whenever the prior approval of the governing body is required before the airport board can act such prior approval shall be first obtained otherwise the board shall be charged with the supervision and management of all municipal airport facilities and functions part 2005   board regulations any recommendation by the airport board to the governing body shall be by resolution and submitted in writing to the city commission for consideration when any ordinance of the governing body is passed upon the recommendation of the airport board it is not necessary for such ordinance to recite at length the resolution of the airport board recommending the same but it is sufficient to recite the fact of such recommendation by the airport board which recital shall be conclusive of the making and regularity of such resolution in all proceedings thereafter part 2005   department tax levy the airport boards annual tax levy as may be authorized by the city commission shall be governed by the provisions of chapters 921 and 506 of the south dakota codified laws as now or hereafter amended each tax levy as authorized by state statutes for specific purposes shall not be exceeded by the combination of such levies at any time or for any purpose and as approved by the governing body of the city part 2005   records open to inspection the airport board shall make an annual report to the governing body of its acts and all its expenditures showing the condition of all affairs under its control the governing body may require a report from the airport board at any time and the records books papers and accounts of the board shall at all times be subject to inspection by the mayor finance officer or any committee appointed by the governing body for that purpose or by any citizen part 2005   airport manageremployees the airport board may recommend to the city commission the appointment of an airport manager of the municipal airport who shall be the chief executive officer under the airport board and shall not be an employee under civil service heshe shall hold office at the pleasure of the city commission and receive such salary and benefits as the city commission may determine the airport manager shall on behalf of the city commission and airport board have charge supervision and direction of all activities and of all airport department employees under the jurisdiction of the airport board and the city commission upon the recommendation of the airport board the city commission may appoint and employ other officers and employees as it may deem necessary and may prescribe and fix their duties and compensation in accordance with the provisions of title 3 of the municipal part 2005   bond for employees the airport board may recommend to the city commission that airport department officers and employees give bond for the faithful performance of their duties in such sum as shall be fixed by it which bonds shall be filed with the city finance officer part 2005   collection of fees and rents the airport manager shall collect for the municipal airport department from all persons desiring and who use the facilities of the airport all fees aside from such fees as are otherwise regularly remitted to the city finance officer all collections shall be transmitted to the city finance officer monthly all money received by the airport manager shall be acknowledged by himher upon triplicate receipt each bearing hisher signature the original of such triplicate shall be delivered to the persons making the payment the duplicate delivered to the city finance officer when the collection is transmitted and the triplicate shall be retained for the records of the municipal airport department part 2005   airport revenue fund the city finance officer shall credit to and keep in a separate municipal airport account all money derived from the tax levy provided for by chapters 921 and 506 of the south dakota codified laws and any other revenues received for the use of the municipal airport facilities and shall pay the same upon requisition by the president and secretary of the board and warrant drawn and executed hereinbefore provided part 2005   annual budget the airport board on or before july 15th shall make an estimate of the moneys necessary for the operation of the airport department and as authorized by of the south dakota codified laws such estimate shall be certified by the secretary of the airport board to the city finance officer on or before 1st day of august each year the proposed airport budget shall be considered by the city commission during its normal budget process and the proposed budget submitted by the airport board may be approved with or without modification as deemed appropriate by the city commission part 2005   department expenditures except as otherwise specifically provided all sums used for the purpose of acquiring land constructing equipping maintaining buildings and other airport facilities as authorized by chapters 506 507 and 508 of the south dakota codified laws shall be paid out of the moneys derived from the annual tax levy and other general revenues of the municipal airport department credited for the use of the airport and such moneys shall be appropriated by ordinance in the same manner as other money is appropriated by the governing body of the city part 2005   acquisition of land upon recommendation of the airport board the governing body may provide by ordinance for the purchase condemnation or otherwise acquisition of land within or without the city limits as authorized by chapters 921 and 506 of the south dakota codified laws payment for any such land selected and acquired may be made out of the money derived from the tax levy provided by chapters 921 and 506 of the south dakota codified laws or any other money received for the use of the airport board or by the issue and sale of bonds of the city after authorization as provided by law part 2005   contracts for construction and improvements pursuant to state law contracts for any construction or improvements incidental to the operation of the municipal airport for which special assessments are not to be levied shall be let by the airport board to the lowest responsible bidder in the same manner and subject to the same provisions as similar work not under control of the airport board with engineering assistance and supervision from a registered or qualified engineer part 2005   fees for water and sewer permits fees for water and sewer permits at the municipal airport shall be the same as for other such permits within the city limits which shall be issued by the city and credited to the proper city funds designated for such purposes part 2005   airport zoning ordinance the governing body shall establish an airport zoning ordinance in conformity with federal and state laws and be approved by the federal aviation administration and the state aeronautics commission prior to adoption part 2005   airport building permits building permits in the airport area must conform to the current master airport layout plan as established by the governing body all building permits shall conform to the provisions of the airport zoning ordinance and city building codes unless granted exceptions by the governing body building permits shall be issued by and city building inspectors office at the request of the airport board part 2005   city attorneys duties the city attorney as a part of his duties shall conduct all court proceedings under this chapter and shall be the legal advisor of the board when in its judgment the interests of the city demand the city commission may employ special counsel to assist the city attorney at the city attorneys request part 2005   general regulations ground rules etc the airport manager shall enforce a schedule of general regulations ground rules etc not inconsistent with the civil aeronautics air regulations which shall be approved by the airport board when approved a set of such rules shall be filed in the office of the city engineer city finance officer and office of the airport manager the airport board reserves the right by a majority vote of the airport board to revoke cancel or change any or all rules or parts thereof in any contingencies not specifically covered by these rules the airport board shall be the arbitrators part 2005   violationspenalties all federal state and local laws and ordinances pertaining to intoxicating liquors and narcotics will be respected by all persons connected with the municipal airport operations under penalty of arrest revocation of license and withdrawal of privileges granted under the provisions of this chapter and the huron municipal airport manager andor police officers of the city will have authority to enforce all rules and regulations established by ordinance and the airport board any person violating these rules or refusing to comply therewith will be subject to the penalties provided by law the air traffic rules of the federal aviation administration and future amendments thereto are made a part of this chapter and incorporated herein any person firm or corporation violating any of the provisions of this chapter or the rules and regulations adopted by the duly appointed airport board or city commission or failing to comply with any of the provisions thereof is guilty of a misdemeanor part 2005 airport zoning airport zoning   1950   definitions as used in this chapter unless the context otherwise requires 1 airport means the w w howes municipal airport 2 airport hazard means any structure or tree or use of land which obstructs the airspace required for the flight of aircraft in landing or taking off at the airport or is otherwise hazardous to such landing or taking off of aircraft 3 nonconforming use except as otherwise provided in this chapter it shall be unlawful to put any land located within any zone hereby created to any of the following prohibited uses 1 transformer stations 2 high power transmission lines 3 manufacturing establishments or other uses which produce smoke interfering with the safe use of the airport 4 all plants and businesses of every kind which emit or discharge gases and odors that would interfere with the health or safety of the public in the use of the airport 5 businesses or structures of any kind that may be detrimental or injurious to the health safety and general welfare of the public in the use of the airport 6 any other use which would create electrical interference with radio communications between the airport and aircraft make it difficult for flyers to distinguish between airport lights and others result in glare in the eyes of flyers using the airport impair visibility in the vicinity of the airport or otherwise endanger the landing takingoff or the maneuvering of aircraft  as amended by      spacing requirements of adjacent airports 1 within a radius of eight miles from the center of the w w howes municipal airport no airport of class 1 or greater as hereinafter defined shall be established unless permit therefor shall have been applied for and granted in accordance with the provision of this chapter 2 except as otherwise provided the minimum distance between the w w howes municipal airport and any other airport hereafter established measured from center to center shall be not less than provided in the following schedule class of other airport distance from w w howes municipal airport class i  4 miles class ii  5 miles class iii  6 miles class iv or larger  7 miles 3 airport classification for the purpose of levelii  3700 to 4700 feet plus 14 elev above sea leveliii  over 4700 feet plus 14 elev above sea leveliv or larger 4 exceptions to the spacing requirements hereinbefore provided in this section may be granted by the board of adjustment which is hereby authorized to allow lesser distances between the w w howes municipal airport and any other airport proposed to be established but only after public hearing duly held in accordance with the provisions of this chapter and where owing to special conditions the board of adjustment duly finds that a literal enforcement of these provisions would result in unnecessary hardship and such variance would not be contrary to the public interest prior to the granting of any such exception or variance the board of adjustment shall for the purpose of study and recommendation refer the matter to the south dakota aeronautics commission and to any local aviation commission airport zoning commission and any local planning body having jurisdiction within the area affected if any of the aforementioned bodies to whom the matter shall have been referred does not within fortyfive days transmit a report to the board of adjustment then it shall be deemed to have approved the proposal provided however that upon request of any said bodies the board of adjustment shall grant a reasonable extension of such time in granting such exception or variance the board of adjustment shall impose special conditions which will ensure that the public interest is maintained  as amended by      existing nonconforming uses 1 regulations not retroactive otherwise interfere with the continuance of any nonconforming use nothing herein contained shall require any change in the construction alteration or intended use of any structure the construction or alteration of which has begun prior to  and is diligently prosecuted and completed within two years thereof 2 marking and lighting notwithstanding the preceding provisions of this section the owner of any nonconforming structure or tree is hereby required to permit the installation operation and maintenance thereof of such markers and lights as shall be deemed necessary by the city engineer or building inspector to indicate to the operators of aircraft in the vicinity of the airport the presence of such airport hazards such markers and lights shall be installed operated and maintained at the expense of the city of huron  as amended by      enforcement it shall be the duty of the city engineer or the building inspector to administer and enforce the regulations prescribed herein applications for permits and variances shall be made to the city engineer or the building inspector applications which are by this chapter to be decided by the city engineer or the building inspector shall be promptly considered and granted or denied by them applications for action by the governing body of the city of huron shall be forthwith transmitted by the city auditor to the board for hearing and decision   as amended by      permits 1 future uses no material change shall be made in the use of land and no structure or tree shall be erected altered planted or otherwise established which would violate the provisions of this chapter in any zone hereby created unless a permit therefor shall have been applied for and granted each such application shall indicate the purpose for which the permit is desired with sufficient particularity to permit it to be determined whether the resulting use structure or tree would conform to the regulations herein prescribed if such determination is in the affirmative the permit shall be granted 2 existing uses before any existing use structure or tree may be replaced substantially altered or repaired rebuilt allowed to grow higher or replanted in violation to the provisions of this chapter within any zone hereby created a permit must be secured authorizing such replacement change or repair no such permit shall be granted that would allow the establishment or creation of an airport hazard or permit a nonconforming use structure or tree to be made or become higher or become a greater hazard to air navigation than it was on  or the effective date of any amendment or than it is when the application for a permit is made except as indicated all applications for such permits shall be granted 3 nonconforming uses abandoned or destroyed whenever the city engineer or the building inspector determines that a nonconforming structure or tree has been abandoned or more than eighty per cent torn down physically deteriorated or decayed a no permit shall be granted that would allow such structure or tree to exceed the applicable height limit or otherwise deviate from the zoning regulations and b whether application is made for a permit under this paragraph or not the city engineer or the building inspector may by appropriate action compel the owner of the nonconforming structure or tree at his own expense to lower remove reconstruct or equip such object as may be necessary to conform to the regulations or if the owner of the nonconforming structure or tree shall neglect or refuse to comply with such an order after ten days notice thereof the city engineer or building inspector may proceed to have the object so lowered removed or equipped and assess the cost and expense thereof upon the object or the land wherein it is or was located unless such an assessment is paid within ninety days from the service of notice thereof on the agent or owner of such object or land the sum shall bear interest at the rate of six per cent per annum until paid and shall be collected in the same manner as are general taxes except as indicated herein all applications for permits for replacement change or repair of nonconforming uses shall be granted 4 variances any person desiring to erect or increase the height of any structure or permit the growth of any tree or use his property not in accordance with the regulations prescribed in this chapter may apply to the governing body of the city of huron for a variance from such regulations such variance shall be allowed where it is duly found that a literal application or enforcement of the regulations would result in practical difficulty or unnecessary hardship and the relief granted would not be contrary to the public interest but do substantial justice and be in accordance with the spirit of this chapter 5 hazard marking and lighting any permit or variance granted may if such action is deemed advisable effectuates the purpose of this chapter and is reasonable in the circumstances be so conditioned as to require the owner of the structure or tree in question to permit the city of huron at its own expense to install operate and maintain thereon such markers and lights as may be necessary to indicate to flyers the presence of an airport hazard  as amended by      appeals 1 any person aggrieved or taxpayer affected by any decision of the city engineer or the building inspector made in their administration of this chapter or any governing body of a political subdivision or any joint airport zoning board if of the opinion that a decision of the city engineer or the building inspector is an improper application of these regulations of concern to such governing body or board may appeal to the board of adjustment 2 all appeals hereunder must be taken within a reasonable time as provided by the rules of the board of adjustment by filing with the city auditor for the city engineer or the building inspector and with the board a notice of appeal specifying the grounds thereof the city engineer or building inspector shall forthwith transmit to the board all the papers constituting the record upon which the action appealed from was taken 3 an appeal shall stay all proceedings in furtherance of the action appealed from unless the city engineer or building inspector certifies to the board after the notice of appeal has been filed with it that by reason of the facts stated in certificate a stay would in their opinion cause imminent peril to life or property in such case proceedings shall not be stayed otherwise than by order of the board and on due cause shown 4 the board shall fix a reasonable time for the hearing of the appeal give public notice and due notice to the parties in interest and decide the same within a reasonable time upon the hearing any party may appear in person or by agent or by attorney 5 the board may in conformity with the provisions of this chapter reverse or affirm wholly or in part or modify the order requirement decision or determination appealed from and may make such order requirement decision or determination as ought to be made and to that end shall have the powers of the city engineer or building inspector  as amended by      board of adjustment 1 it shall be the duty of the governing body to act as the board of adjustment and have and exercise the following powers a to hear and decide appeals from any order requirement decision or determination made by the city engineer or building inspector in the enforcement of this chapter b to hear and decide special exceptions to the terms of this chapter upon which such board may be required to pass under such regulations c to hear and decide specific variances under 2 the board shall adopt rules for its governance and procedure in harmony with the provisions of this chapter meetings of the board shall be held at the call of the mayor and at such other times as the board may determine the chairman or in his absence the acting chairman may administer oaths and compel the attendance of witnesses all hearings of the board shall be public the board shall keep minutes of its proceedings showing the vote of each member upon each question or if absent or failing to vote indicating such fact and shall keep records of its examinations and other official actions all of which shall immediately be filed in the office of the city auditor and shall be a public record the office of the city auditor shall be the office of the board 3 the board shall make written findings of fact and conclusions of law giving the facts upon which it acted and its legal conclusions from such facts in reversing or affirming or modifying any order requirement decision or determination which comes before it under the provisions of this chapter 4 the concurring vote of a majority of the members of the board shall be sufficient to reverse any order requirement decision or determination of the city engineer or building inspector or to decide in favor of the applicant on any matter upon which it is required to pass under this chapter or to effect any variation in this chapter  as amended by      judicial review 1 any person aggrieved or taxpayer affected by any decision of the board of adjustment or any governing body of a political subdivision or any joint airport zoning board which is of the opinion that a decision of the board of adjustment is illegal may present to the district court a verified petition setting forth that the decision is illegal in whole or in part and specifying the grounds of illegality such petition shall be presented to the court within thirty days after the decision is filed in the office of the board 2 upon presentation of such petition the court may allow a writ of certiorari directed to the board of adjustment to review such decision of the board the allowance of the writ shall not stay proceedings upon the decision appealed from but the court may on application on notice to the board and on due cause shown grant a restraining order 3 the board of adjustment shall not be required to return the original papers acted upon by it but it shall be sufficient to return certified or sworn copies thereof or of such portions thereof as may be called for by the writ the return shall concisely set forth such other facts as may be pertinent and material to show the grounds of the decision appealed from and shall be verified 4 the court shall have exclusive jurisdiction to affirm modify or set aside the decision brought up for review in whole or in part and if need be to order further proceedings by the board of adjustment the findings of fact of the board if supported by substantial evidence shall be accepted by the court as conclusive and no objection to a decision of the board shall be considered by the court unless such objection shall have been urged before the board or if it was not so urged unless there were reasonable grounds for failing to do so 5 costs shall not be allowed against the board unless it appears to the court that it acted with gross negligence in bad faith or with malice in making the decision appealed from 6 in any case where these regulations although generally reasonable are held by a court to interfere with the use or enjoyment of a particular structure or parcel of land to such an extent or to be onerous in their application to such a structure or parcel of land as to constitute a taking or deprivation of that property in violation of the constitution of this state or the constitution of the united states such holding shall not affect the application of such regulations to other structures and parcels of land  as amended by      conflicting regulations where this chapter imposes a greater or more stringent restriction upon the use of land than is imposed or required by any other ordinance or regulation the provision of this chapter shall govern  as amended by      penalties each following sections of this chapter  1950   buildings fronting on avenues buildings fronting the avenues of this city shall be numbered from center street  such numbers shall be zero at center street and not to exceed the number 99 at the end of the first blocks either north or south of center street 101 at the beginning and not to exceed the number 199 at the end of the second blocks either north or south of center street such system shall be followed in numbering buildings on all of the avenues city  1950   buildings fronting on streets buildings fronting the streets of this city shall be last numeral in number buildings fronting the avenues from the east and fronting streets from the south shall bear even numbers in their last figure buildings fronting avenues from the west and fronting streets from the north shall bear odd numbers in their last figure in blocks containing three hundred fifty feet the unit for determining the last figure of each number shall be eight and onethird feet thus the first twentyfive feet from the numbering center shall be entitled to use the numbers 1 3 and 5  on the opposite side of the street the first twentyfive feet shall be entitled to use the numbers 2 4 and 6 in blocks containing five hundred feet the unit for determining the final figure shall be twelve and onehalf feet thus the first twentyfive feet from the center of numbering shall be entitled to use the numbers 1 and 3 or on the opposite side of the street the numbers 2 and 4 no deductions for alleys shall be used in figuring numbers  1950 street workgeneral provisions culverts under private driveways a the owner of any premises within the city where a new driveway is to be installed which would restrict the flow of runoff in a ditch shall be required to install a culvert under the driveway the elevation and size of the culvert shall be established by the city engineer and the culvert shall be installed under the engineers direction b culverts under private drives which are damaged or restricted to the point where they restrict the flow of runoff sufficiently to cause potential damage to roadways or property shall be repaired or replaced by the owner c the city will furnish the culverts if the culverts were installed prior to the effective date of the ordinance codified in this section and the restriction is due to the culvert being undersized the city will only furnish the replacement culvert for these undersized culverts if approved by the city engineer prior to installation the owner shall have the culvert replaced and pay for the cost of replacement d the city engineer upon becoming aware of a damaged or restricted culvert and after inspection thereof shall give written notice to owner to repair or replace the culvert the owner shall be given ten days to correct the problem if there is an immediate threat to roadways or property if the threat is not immediate the property owner shall be given thirty days to correct the problem if the problem has not been corrected by the date given in the notice to the owner the city shall have the problem corrected and the costs shall be filed with the finance officer the costs shall be defined as the actual costs plus the sum of fifty dollars for administrative costs e the finance officer shall cause a statement of the costs of the abatement of the problem to be served upon the owner agent of the owner lessee occupant or person in possession of the parcel of land for which the driveway and culvert are providing access the notice may be given personally or by first class mail with break destroy or carry away any barricades or lanterns used by the city or any contractor in guarding unsafe or dangerous places in the maintenance or repair of streets or in any lawful work being carried on by the city or contractor  added by      refilling excavations any person or firm making such excavations and having completed the purpose for which the excavation was made shall notify the city engineer that the excavation is ready for refilling and when authorized by the city engineer to proceed with the refilling operation the person or firm shall promptly and without delay refill the excavation under the provisions provided herein in refilling any excavation the earth shall be compacted to a density equaling that of the undisturbed and original material adjacent to said excavation the required degree of compaction shall be obtained by backfilling in accordance with that procedure of the two procedures listed hereinafter that is most adaptable to the material to be replaced in said excavation procedure no 1 the backfill material shall be inundated and when necessary to obtain proper compaction mechanical vibration shall be used procedure no 2 the backfill material shall be placed in six inch layers each of which shall be individually mechanically tamped the moisture content of the backfill material shall be adjusted when necessary the engineer shall specify which procedure is the most adaptable method for use in the placement of backfill material in each excavation excavations shall be backfilled in such a manner that all the earth shall be replaced in the excavation leaving the surface in its original condition except where excavations have been made in the driving areas of any avenue street alley or driveway the backfill shall be replaced with a minimum of eight inches in depth of compacted gravel from the original surface and the original excess dirt shall be removed and disposed of by the excavator and the excavator will be responsible for keeping excavations full until the street department has available time and materials to finish these excavations with gravel black top or cement in making connection to fire hydrants for flushing excavations all rules and regulations of the water department relating thereto shall be observed in all cases where excavations are made in the paved district the earth and gravel shall be replaced in the manner above specified and the pavement shall be replaced by the department of streets       1950   cutting pavements where it is necessary to cut the street pavement in making any street excavation there shall be deposited with the finance officer before permit is issued an amount designated by resolution of the governing board on a per square yard basis of pavement removed the amended by      width and thickness of sidewalks and driveways a residence district the width of all sidewalks in the residence district shall be established by the city engineer and none shall be less than four feet in width and four inches thick with cut joints every four feet and expansion joints every twentyfive feet such expansion joints to be composed of materials and thickness as approved by the city engineer b business district all sidewalks in the business district and in front of all places of business shall extend from the established property line or abutting business structure to the curb line unless otherwise approved by the city engineer and shall be four inches thick cut into convenient sections at least two inches deep throughout with expansion joints every twentyfive feet and adjoining brick or stone walls such joints to be composed of such materials and thickness as approved by the city engineer c crossing driveway or alley all sidewalks constructed or repaired in the residential or business district which cross or are a part of a driveway or alley shall be constructed six inches thick with expansion joints of a material and thickness approved by the city engineer shall be installed at all abutting curbs sidewalks driveways and structures d driveways all driveways constructed or repaired within the streets of the city of huron shall be no less than six inches thick or four inches thick reinforced with a minimum of six inch by six inch number six gauge wire reinforcing mesh and the width shall be as set forth in the latest driveway standards from any sidewalk upon their property within 48 hours after any snowfall snow or ice accumulation so that sidewalks are clean and safe for pedestrians for safe and convenient foot travel snow and ice must also be removed from that portion of the sidewalk which ends at an intersection or crosswalk including the curb ramp any owner tenant or occupant of property abutting sidewalks on two intersecting streets must remove all snow and ice from the sidewalks of both streets regardless of the source of the snow accumulation snow and ice deposited on the sidewalk from the street snow removal process must also be removed within 48 hours of being deposited failure to remove snow and ice from a sidewalk in accordance with this section constitutes an ordinance violation in the event ice has so formed upon a sidewalk that it cannot be removed then the owner tenant or occupant must use sand salt or other suitable substance in such manner as to prevent the ice from being dangerous other private property onto a public street alley or sidewalk any owner tenant or occupant of a building lot or land bordering any street within the city where there is a curbside sidewalk outside of the core area shall within fortyeight 48 hours after a snow accumulation event cause a path at least fortyeight 48 inches in width to be cleared and the path shall be located within five feet and parallel to the existing sidewalk on the yard side of the sidewalk said path shall be cleared to allow continuous pedestrian traffic across the lot any owner tenant or occupant of a building lot or land bordering any street within the core area of the city where there is a sidewalk shall comply with these provisions within twentyfour 24 hours after a snow accumulation event such snow may be deposited in the parking spaces adjacent to the sidewalk within only first the twentyfour 24 hours following the snow accumulation event any owner tenants or occupants as aforesaid failing to comply penalty any railroad company maintaining or operating any railroad onto or across any thoroughfare within the city shall construct thereat a crossing and shall keep open maintain and repair all such crossings as required by the city all such railroads shall make keep open and repair ditches drains sewers and culverts along and under their tracks so that drainage of adjacent property shall not be impeded and the right of way shall be properly drained in all cases where in the opinion of the governing body it is necessary for the safety and protection of the public that thoroughfare crossings over railway tracks be lighted or thoroughfare crossing alarms signs or automatic signals installed to notify the public of approaching trains the governing body may cause the railroad company over whose line such thoroughfare crosses to install lights crossing alarms or automatic signals for the purpose of notifying the public of approaching trains in such manner and by such method as in the opinion of the governing body will be most suitable for the protection of the public whenever the governing body shall deem it necessary to order the construction reconstruction or repair of any thoroughfare crossing or of ditches drains and sewers or the installation of lights crossing alarms or automatic signals at any crossing it shall declare in a proposed resolution the necessity of such construction repair or improvement describing therein the crossing ditch drain or sewer to be improved and the nature of such improvement and the time and place at which it will meet to consider the adoption of such resolution such resolution shall be published once a week for three consecutive weeks prior to the time specified in such resolution for the consideration of the adoption of the same a copy of such resolution shall also be served upon the railroad company involved at least fifteen days prior to the meeting in the manner provided by law for the service of a summons upon a railroad corporation at the time of such meeting or hearing or at any adjournment thereof the governing body shall investigate and consider the matter and shall hear the evidence and testimony of all parties appearing or interested therein at the conclusion of such hearing the governing body may reject or adopt such resolution with or without amendment as it shall deem proper such resolution shall be published take effect and be subject to referendum as other resolutions and upon taking effect a copy of such resolution duly certified by the auditor shall be served upon the railroad company involved in the manner provided by law for the service of a summons upon a railroad corporation thereafter and within twenty days or such longer time as may be granted by the governing body as set forth in such resolution said railroad company shall do and perform all acts required by such resolution any railroad company neglecting to comply with the requirements of any resolution duly enacted in accordance with this section shall be liable to a penalty of twentyfive dollars for each day such neglect shall continue to be recovered in a civil action in the name of the city and paid into the general fund of the city  added by      penalty for violation any person firm or corporation violating any of the provisions of this chapter shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and shall be guilty of a separate offense for each and every day that the violation continues and shall be subject to a penalty pursuant to the general penalty provision in except for purposes of this chapter any such fine imposed hereunder shall not be less than one hundred dollars  street alley and public ground vacations   requirements for vacation 1 a street alley or public ground or any part thereof that is currently being used for public purposes may be considered for vacation by the city commission only after receiving a petition signed by the owners of all land adjacent to the street or alley  or 2 whenever a street or alley or any part thereof has not been used or traveled as a street or alley at any time during the preceding twenty years the land may be vacated by the governing body upon application of the owner or owners of all the real property abutting upon both sides thereof part 2007   procedure for requesting vacation 1 such petition shall set forth the facts and the reasons for such vacation and shall be accompanied by the existing plat of such street alley or public ground proposed to be vacated such petition shall be signed by all of the adjacent property owners and shall be verified by the affidavit of such owner or owners or his or their agent or attorney the verified petition shall be filed at the city planning and inspections office with the filing fee in the amount as set by resolution of the governing board 2 any street alley or public ground that is vacated process may be dedicated at the discretion of the city commission in perpetuity by the owners to the public as an easement for the installation of any publicly accepted utilityies the platting of the area as an easement shall occur at no cost to the city the entire width and length of the area vacated shall be platted and dedicated as a public easement area 3 a hearing on the petition shall be held by the city planning commission if the street alley or other public ground to be vacated is within city limits and shall be held by the joint planning commission if the street alley or other public ground to be vacated is outside city limits but within the joint jurisdictional planning area a sign providing notice of the meeting in front of the appropriate planning commission will be placed at each end of the street or alley or part thereof sought to be vacated and upon such other public ground sought to be vacated at such locations which provide reasonable notice of the hearing the recommendation of the city planning commission will be forwarded to the city commission for consideration and the recommendation of the joint planning commission will be forwarded to the city commission and to the county commission for consideration 4 notice of the proposed vacation shall be published once a week for two successive weeks prior to a public hearing being held on said petition by the city commission the notice shall state that a petition has been filed briefly state the object of the petition and the date that the petition will be heard and considered by the governing body the hearing shall be held not less than ten days from the last publication of the notice at the public hearing the city commission will take into consideration any testimony provided by the public the recommendations of the planning commission and the recommendations of city departments that may have an interest in the proposed vacation 5 a resolution of vacation shall be published and is subject to referendum upon taking effect a copy of the resolution certified by the city finance officer shall be filed in the office of the register of deeds 6 if the city commission approves the vacation the applicants shall have a plat of the vacated area be prepared at no cost to the city said plat to show new property lines created as a result of said vacation and any utility or other easements upon the area vacated the plat will be approved normal plat approval process and the applicants submitting the petition for vacation shall pay the appropriate fee at the time that the plat is submitted for approval the applicants isare required to have the plat recorded at the office of register of deeds at applicants sole expense and shall provide the city a copy of the filed plat showing the date book and page number where the plat may be found in the beadle county office of the register of deeds 7 no petition for vacation of a street alley or other public ground may be submitted and filed with the planning and inspections office less than six months following a denial by the city commission of an identical or substantially similar petition part 2007  moving buildings footnotes  8  editors note prior ordinance history ords 123 116 592 578 487 and   state law reference 1992   removing telephone wires etc and planking streets any person firm or corporation to whom a permit for moving buildings is granted shall see that all telegraph telephone or electric wires or poles are removed when necessary and replaced in good order and shall be liable for the costs of the same  and necessary trimming of any trees or branches en route shall be done or supervised by the along any street avenue or alley shall wilfully or negligently permit such building while in transit to remain upon the street avenue alley or sidewalk the street commissioner shall have the authority keep an account of the expense of such removal and said person firm or corporation and the sureties on the bond filed as required by the provisions of this chapter shall be liable to the city for such this chapter is guilty of a misdemeanor and each such person is guilty of a separate offense for each and every day or portion thereof during which any violation of any of the provisions of this chapter is committed continued or permitted and upon conviction of any such violation such person is punishable by a fine of not more than one hundred dollars or by imprisonment for not more than of every way publicly maintained by the municipality for purposes of vehicular travel including but not limited to such areas designated as avenues or drives when any part thereof is open to the use prolongation of the lateral curblines or if none then of the lateral boundary lines of two or more streets or roadways which join one another at an angle whether or not one such street or roadway crosses the other  e 1950   sidewalk the word sidewalk means a paved walkway on municipally owned property for pedestrian traffic  f 1950    boulevard the street rightof way area owned by the municipality between the edge of the curb or edge of the street if there is no curb and the property line of the adjacent property    crosswalk the word crosswalk means that portion of a street ordinarily included within the prolongation of curb and property lines at intersections whether or not marked or any other portion of a street clearly indicated for pedestrian crossing by lines or other markings on the surface g 1950    vehicle the word vehicle means every device motorized and nonmotorized in upon or by which any person or property is or may be transported or drawn upon a public street except devices used exclusively upon stationary rails or tracks  for the purpose of this title a bicycle or a ridden animal shall be deemed a vehicle h 1950    motor vehicle the term motor vehicle means every vehicle which is selfpropelled i 1950   pedestrian the word pedestrian means any person afoot j 1950   driver the word driver means every person who drives or is in actual  1950   manner of arrest except when reasonably necessary to secure appearance a person charged with violation of a traffic ordinance of the city by a police officer need not be arrested in the regular manner but may first be given an opportunity after notice to appear voluntarily to answer for such traffic violation this procedure shall not apply to any person arrested and charged with an offense causing or contributing to an accident resulting in injury or death to any person nor to any person charged with reckless driving nor to any person charged with driving while under the influence of intoxicating liquor or narcotic drugs  1950   notice to appear a person charged with violation of a traffic ordinance by notice shall be given a notice to appear before the court at the time stated in such notice and stating that in the event of failure so to do a warrant will be issued for his arrest the notice shall state the time and nature of the offense and shall also describe the vehicle involved in the violation by trade name and by license number the nature of the offense may be stated by marking an x in a blank opposite the word or words employed to designate the nature of the offense the notice shall be signed or initialed by the police officer executing it who shall also put thereon his identification number the notice shall be made in duplicate one copy to be given to the owner or driver charged with the offense or to be left in or upon the automobile involved in the violation and the other copy to be filed with the department part 1993  1950   appearance whenever the operation of any other vehicle may be affected by such movement shall give a signal plainly visible to the driver of such other vehicle of the intention to make such movement b whenever the signal is given by means of the hand and arm the driver shall indicate his intention by extending the hand and arm from the left side of the vehicle in the following manner  and such signals shall
